description: This table contains information on procedures associated with referrals. This table is related to the REFERRAL_ORDER_ID table. The REFERRAL_ORDER_ID table contains the list of procedures for the referral. The REFERRAL_PX table contains information on each of those procedures.

columns.name: REFERRAL_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the referral in database.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number of the procedure associated with the referral. For example, if a referral has two associated procedures, the first procedure will have a line value of 1, while the second procedure will have a line value of 2.

columns.name: PX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure associated with the referral. This is frequently used to join to the CLARITY_EAP table.

columns.name: UNITS_REQUESTED
columns.description: The number of units of this procedure that were requested

columns.name: UNITS_APPROVED
columns.description: The number of units of this procedure that were approved

columns.name: TOTAL_PRICE
columns.description: The total price calculated for this procedure using fee schedules or vendor contracts (for outgoing referrals)

columns.name: NET_PAYABLE
columns.description: The total net payable calculated for this procedure (the price - the patient portion).

columns.name: PATIENT_PORTION
columns.description: The total patient responsibility calculated for this procedure using the benefits engine

columns.name: PROV_ID
columns.description: The ID of the provider who will perform the service

columns.name: AUTH_REQ_YN
columns.description: A flag that indicates whether the member's benefits require a referral for this service. Yes=> a referral is required, No=> a referral is not required.

columns.name: COVERED
columns.description: A flag that indicates whether the procedure is not covered by the member's benefits or it is covered but by supplemental insurance

columns.name: REVENUE_CODE_ID
columns.description: Stores the revenue billing code entered on the service.
